p.span: The context is a 'Crossover Driven' context. Crossover points (boundaries) between concepts in a context is derived from the search.. A crossover point is the point where membersip in the intersecting concepts is equal (0.5).

index=demographics | stats count(Height) as count perc1(Height) as min perc20(Height) as minimal_low perc40(Height) as low_medium perc60(Height) as medium_high perc80(Height) as high_extreme perc99(Height) as max | xsCreateCDContext name=Height container=Height scope=app terms="minimal,low,medium,high,extreme" read="*" write="*"
Creates a Crossover Defined context with crossover points at 20%, 40%, 60%, and 80% with 5 terms (minimal, low, medium, high, extreme).
app, class, container, endshape, name, notes, read, scope, search, shape, terms, type, uom, write
The application to store the context.
A comma separated list of classes.
The container to store the context.
The shape of the end concepts. This defaults to curve.
A legal string which specifies the name by which the created Context will be known.
A description of the context. This defaults to 'none'.
Read permissions (i.e., roles) . This defaults to * (for all roles).
Save the context after it is created. The default value is "true". To turn off save, set save=false.
Where to save the context (private, app, or application name). This defaults to private.
The search string used to generate data
The shape of the middle concepts. This defaults to pi.
A comma delimited set of legal strings which define the names of the terms within the Context. There must be 3 or more terms.
domain - the default, centers the set on (max-min)/2 and scales the context to cover the whole domain
Write permissions (i.e., roles) . This defaults to * (for all roles).

The context created by xsCreateCDContext is displayed in table or chart format. See xsDisplayContext for details about display of the created Context.
